hotels.name: Sandpiper Lodging
hotels.description: Right on the beach! The closest stay to the venue. Book early — rooms go fast in summer.

hotels.name: The Pelican Inn
hotels.description: A charming English-style inn just 15 minutes from Stinson Beach. Great breakfast included!

hotels.name: Mill Valley Inn
hotels.description: A cozy boutique hotel in the heart of Mill Valley. Perfect base for exploring Marin County.

hotels.name: Holiday Inn Express Sausalito
hotels.description: Budget-friendly option with great views of the bay. About 30 minutes from the venue.

transportation.title: From San Francisco International Airport (SFO)
transportation.description: SFO is about 45 minutes to 1 hour south of Stinson Beach. We recommend renting a car — the drive up through Mill Valley and over Mt. Tam is gorgeous!

transportation.title: From Oakland International Airport (OAK)
transportation.description: OAK is about 1 hour east. Take the Richmond-San Rafael Bridge for a scenic route, or come through SF via the Bay Bridge.

transportation.title: Rideshare & Taxis
transportation.description: Uber and Lyft service the area, but availability can be limited in Stinson Beach, especially late at night. Plan ahead for your return trip!

transportation.title: Parking
transportation.description: Free parking is available at the venue and along Shoreline Highway. Arrive a bit early on the wedding day to snag a good spot.

thingsToKnow.title: Weather
thingsToKnow.description: July in Stinson Beach is usually sunny with temperatures around 65-75°F. However, the famous NorCal fog can roll in quickly — bring a light jacket or shawl for the evening!

thingsToKnow.title: Beach Attire Tips
thingsToKnow.description: The ceremony is on the sand! We recommend wedges or block heels instead of stilettos, or go barefoot — we will be! Sunglasses encouraged.

thingsToKnow.title: Cell Service
thingsToKnow.description: Cell service can be spotty in Stinson Beach. Download offline maps before you head out, and embrace the digital detox vibes!

thingsToKnow.title: Things To Do
thingsToKnow.description: If you're making a trip of it, don't miss: hiking in Muir Woods, driving the Pacific Coast Highway, exploring Point Reyes, and grabbing fish tacos at the local spots.
